Description.val:
[P5 / NU019 EPLRS-DR/EMUT]: Enhanced Position Location Reporting System - Data Radio (EPLRS-DR)/Enhanced Man-Pack UHF Tactical (EMUT) is a Blue in Support of Green (BISOG) program that provides secure Anti-Jam (AJ), Ultra High Frequency (UHF) (420-450 MHz) and Line of Sight (LOS) data communications in support of amphibious operations at throughputs of up to 54 Kbps. EPLRS-DR provides embedded Position Location Information (PLI) between shipboard networks and the shore-based Marine Tactical Data Network (TDN) and the Army Tactical Internet (TI). To meet a National Security Agency (NSA) mandate, KOK13 cryptographic equipment was replaced with KOK23/Combat Key Generator (CKG) cryptographic equipment. EPLRS/EMUT efforts will include antenna upgrades. EPLRS-DR will also include Landing Force Iridium infrastructure.

[P5 / NU790 Navy Expeditionary C4I]: Navy Expeditionary Command, Control, Communications, Computers, & Intelligence (C4I): Executes procurements for outfitting Table of Allowance (TOA) buy lists within the Naval Special Warfare (NSW) forces, ensuring common communications and Automated Data Processing (ADP) solutions are being coordinated, tracked, and procured. Funding reflects establishment, approval and procurement of NSW service-common TOA to begin correcting shortfalls and bringing NSW forces into alignment with required outfitting standards in accordance with SOCOM-USN Memorandum of Agreement.

[P5 / NU239 PORT NSW]: NU239 - PORT NSW: The FY20 budget request has been combined with NU790 to streamline acquisition efforts. 

Portable Radio/Naval Special Warfare (PORT NSW) tactical radio:  PORT NSW procures hand held and man pack/vehicular radios for NSW.  Procurement needed to support Force Protection operations, especially with joint forces.  NSW operational elements (SEAL platoons and Combatant Craft Detachments) rely on tactical communications and electronics equipment to accomplish all missions assigned in support of the Joint and Fleet commanders.  Navy resourced tactical communications equipment is considered mission essential and will be employed by individual SEAL personnel and NSW combat elements in man pack configurations as well as onboard tactical vehicles and NSW combatant craft in tactical operations centers in fixed mount configurations.

[P5 / ESB SOF (BSO 24)]: Expeditionary Mobile Base Special Operations Forces (ESB SOF) - The SOF component requires an ESB (a type of boat) to have the capability for planning and conducting Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) for Boat Assault Force (BAF) and Helicopter Assault Force (HAF) missions.  These funds procure and install equipment to support SOF communications, consisting of a radio backbone infrastructure and increasing the bandwidth to support SOF missions.  These additional capabilities will be back fitted during ESB 4's Post Shakedown Availability.

[P3A / Battle Force Tactical Network]: Battle Force Tactical Network (BFTN): This system is formally specified by both Fleet Commanders as a threshold capability for global maritime command control and communications in a Distributed Maritime Environment to execute current warfighting plans. BFTN enables delivery of Internet Protocol (IP) based collaboration services over legacy High Frequency (HF) assets. The system provides an interoperable, low data rate, multi-node, Beyond-Line-of-Sight (BLOS) tactical edge networking capability using existing HF radio infrastructure. BFTN provides data path backbone for both airborne and afloat forces and increased data exchange with Allied Coalition forces. BFTN provides National, Allied, and Coalition maritime units with a medium band IP-based, tactical ship to ship at-sea networking capability, using legacy half-duplex Ultra High Frequency (UHF) Line-of-Sight and provides the only Allied Coalition HF/UHF Communications in a satellite denied/degraded situation. BFTN will provide a bridge between legacy radio systems and future emerging wideband networking technologies. 

BFTN Resilient Command and Control (RC2) System Enhancement (BRSE): The HF Modernization study (conducted in 2018 by OPNAV N81 and NAVIFOR N82) identified RC2 capability gaps needed to support the RC2 posture. BFTN RC2 System Enhancements (BRSE) will provide the RF network for an "always on/always connected" capability and for increased range and data rate capabilities through an agile RF data networking capability. FY21 BRSE integrates 2-channels of modern radios and modems into a full production system and funds the procurement of fourteen (14) modern software defined radio systems.

[P3A - 2 / Portable Radio Project]: Portable Radio Project is formally specified by both Fleet Commanders as a threshold capability for global maritime command control and communications in a Distributed Maritime Environment to execute current warfighting plans. PRP is the Navy's single point of contact for procurement, life cycle support and future readiness planning of software-defined, portable, tactical hand held and man pack radios.  PRP provides fixed mount radios for Navy Expeditionary and Naval Special Warfare combat forces and Emergency Portable Radios (EPR) for surface ships and other platforms. Patrol Craft installations replace currently fielded AN/PRC-150 radios with crypto modernized AN/PRC-160 radios to meet NSA crypto modernization mandate.

Justification.val:
NU239 - PORT NSW: The FY21 budget request has been combined with NU790 to streamline acquisition efforts. 

NU295 - Battle Force Tactical Network (BFTN):  FY21 OPN funds the procurement of thirty-seven (37) BFTN systems required to meet emerging communications threat environment. In addition, FY21 funds engineering changes to strengthen cyber security posture by implementing WIN 10 upgrades on previously fielded systems. 

NU295 - BFTN Bravo Resilient Command and Control (RC2) System Enhancement (BRSE): FY21 OPN funds the procurement of fourteen (14) software defined radios. These radios will be integrated into systems armed with critical capabilities designed to meet emerging communications threat environments. The design enhancements in these radios include enhanced HF Automatic Link Establishment (ALE) and advanced HF waveforms, which bring increased performance in a contested and congested environment and allow the radios to adjust to spectrum interference, adaptive null steering, and Multiple Input Multiple Output (MIMO).

NU237 - Portable Radio Project: FY21 OPN funds the procurement of Emergency Portable Radios (EPR) crypto modernization for nine (9) ships, which includes ninety (90) hand held radios and thirty-six (36) man packs. In addition, FY21 funds the procurement of twenty (20) AN/PRC-160 radios for patrol craft crypto modernization.
  
NU019 - EPLRS-DR/EMUT: FY21 funding procures eight (8) Enhanced Position Location Reporting System (EPLRS) systems. A complete unit consists of one AN/VRC-114(V)2 radio mount, one RF-5051PS power supply, and associated ancillary equipment. The quantity procured in any given year is determined by the Fleet's demand signal and platform availability. 

NU790 - FY21 funding provides mission critical communications equipment, to include portable hand held radios, man pack radios, secure satellite telephones, unmanned air vehicle (UAV) communication devices, ruggedized laptops, and encryption-decryption devices to US Navy Sea, Air, and Land (SEAL) combat operations in forward deployed contingency locations. This equipment provides real-time, actionable, time-sensitive transmission and reception of mission orders, intelligence, action and engagement status reporting, imaging, and target specification simultaneously in multiple theaters throughout the world. The disaggregated nature of current operations has smaller SEAL Teams deployed across the Geographic Combatant Commanders (GCC) conducting combat or combat advise operations in austere environments with little-to-no established DoD infrastructure. This equipment supports NSW core mission requirements and is essential to the readiness and battlefield effectiveness of NSW in winning the current fight against extremist elements.

Name.@footnote: Funding in FY21 includes procurement for Enhanced Position Location Reporting System - Data Radio (EPLRS-DR), Enhanced Man-Pack Ultra High Frequency (UHF) Tactical (EMUT) Mobile User Objective System (MUOS) antennas, and Landing Force Iridium to meet Marine Embarked Units (MEU) to support High Frequency (HF)/UHF communications between the Landing Force Operations Center (LFOC) and Marines ashore to ensure interoperability between the Navy and Marine Corps. The quantity procured and installed (in any given year) is determined by the Fleet's demand signal and platform availability and leverages the In-Service Engineering Agent (ISEA) to combine installs.

Quantities are not provided based on thousands of various communication and Automated Data Processing (ADP) equipment being procured in support of correcting Naval Special Warfare (NSW) Table of Allowances (TOA) equipment shortfalls.  NSW TOA identifies NSW Sea Air and Land (SEAL) required list of equipment (tactical manpack/vehicular radios, handheld radios, rovers, etc) to meet mission needs. FY21 increase corrects in-theater equipment procurement shortfalls and brings NSW forces into alignment with required outfitting standards in accordance with SOCOM-USN Memorandum of Agreement (MOA). Specific procurements include Embedded National Tactical Receiver (ENTR) for SEAL Teams and NSW Special Boat Teams, impacting over 2,000 personnel, to meet coastal and riverine warfare requirements, as well as cryptographic tactical radios to comply with the newest modernization standards.
NU239 - PORT NSW: Starting in FY20, the budget request has been combined with NU790 to streamline acquisition efforts.

Quantities are not provided since various equipment is being procured to provide Special Operations Forces (SOF) capability on Expeditionary Mobile Base (ESB) 4. Cost increase is to procure remaining SOF components to include several VHF and UHF antennas to be installed during the boats Post Shakedown Availability.
The installations costs are being broken out for transparency. The last time an installation occurred was in FY19. In FY 20 the installation cost (for ESB 4) were included in the recurring cost.
NU555 - PORT NSW Production Support: Starting in FY20, budget request has been combined with NU790 to streamline acquisition efforts.

Consolidated prior years for PORT RAD - Hand Held Procurement, Hydra Procurement, NAVSEA HYDRA Requirement, DAMA IW Procurement, Hydra Installations FMP, HF SAR Installations FMP, and Navy Expeditionary C4I Production Support
This line includes production support for all BFTN variants, to include BRSE.
Name.val: 2.1) BFTN Alpha / BFTN Bravo Production Support

Name.@footnote: This line includes Design Services Allocation (DSA) for BFTN Alpha variant. Pre-Installation DSA are required in order to complete ship check and installation drawings for installation planning and is performed 6-12 months prior to installation start. Post Installation DSA support requirements include drawings closeout. DSA costs will fluctuate each FY as it is a factor of the number of installations in any given fiscal year. In FY21, BFTN funds $0.424M SOVTs and design closeout for eight (8) FY21 installations, and $2.928M for the pre-installation planning for thirty-seven (37) FY22 installations.

This line includes Design Services Allocation (DSA) for BFTN Bravo Resilient Command and Control (RC2) System Enhancement (BRSE) variant. Pre-Installation DSA are required in order to complete ship check and installation drawings for installation planning and is performed 6-12 months prior to installation start. Post Installation DSA support requirements include drawings closeout. DSA costs will fluctuate each FY as it is a factor of the number of installations in any given fiscal year. In FY21, BRSE funds $0.877M for the pre-installation planning for fourteen (14) FY22 installations.

BFTN Bravo Resilient Command and Control (RC2) System Enhancement (BRSE): FY21 OPN funds the procurement of fourteen (14) software defined radios. These radios will be integrated into systems armed with critical capabilities designed to meet emerging communications threat environments. The design enhancements in these radios include enhanced HF Automatic Link Establishment (ALE) and advanced HF waveforms, which bring increased performance in a contested and congested environment and allow the radios to adjust to spectrum interference, adaptive null steering, and Multiple Input Multiple Output (MIMO).

Description.val:
Battle Force Tactical Network (BFTN): This system is formally specified by both Fleet Commanders as a threshold capability for global maritime command control and communications in a Distributed Maritime Environment to execute current warfighting plans. Battle Force Tactical Network (BFTN) is the Navy's near-term solution to Resilient Command and Control (RC2) communications in a satellite denied/degraded environment. 

Funding in FY2021 is for the procurement of thirty-seven (37) Battle Force Tactical Network (BFTN) systems required to meet the emerging communications threat environment. In addition, funding in FY2021 is for engineering changes required to strengthen cyber security posture by implementing WIN 10 upgrades on previously fielded BFTN systems. 

BFTN Resilient Command and Control (RC2) System Enhancement (BRSE): The HF Modernization study (conducted in 2018 by OPNAV N81 and NAVIFOR N82) identified RC2 capability gaps needed to support the RC2 posture. BFTN RC2 System Enhancements (BRSE) will provide the RF network for an "always on/always connected" capability and for increased range and data rate capabilities through an agile RF data networking capability. Funding in FY2021 integrates 2-channels of modern radios and modems into a full production system and funds the procurement of fourteen (14) modern software defined radio systems.

Name.@footnote: Pre-Installation Design Services Allocation (DSA) are required in order to complete ship check and installation drawings for installation planning and is performed 6-12 months prior to installation start. Post Installation DSA support requirements include drawings closeout. DSA costs will fluctuate each FY as it is a factor of the number of installations in any given fiscal year.

Description.val: The Portable Radio Project is formally specified by both Fleet Commanders as a threshold capability for global maritime command control and communications in a Distributed Maritime Environment to execute current warfighting plans. PRP provides fixed mount radios for Navy Expeditionary and Naval Special Warfare combat forces, and Emergency Portable Radios (EPR) for surface ships and other platforms. Patrol Craft installations replace currently fielded AN/PRC-150 radios with crypto modernized AN/PRC-160 radios to meet NSA crypto modernization mandate. Funding in FY2021 is for the procurement of ninety (90) hand held radios and thirty-six (36) man packs for nine (9) ships, and twenty (20) AN/PRC-160 radios for installation on ten (10) patrol crafts.
